file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-44-08-04 - CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the check valve of the accumulator or the check valve of the return line of the Emergency/Parking Brake System. B. The check valve of the accumulator is installed in the hydraulic-system- 2 compartment. C. The check valve of the return line is installed on the wing stub. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 32-44-08-000-801-A CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL ALL 32-44-08-400-801-A CHECK VALVE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-44-08 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-08-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CHECK VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the check valve (accumulator or return line). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION HYDRAULIC ACCUMULATOR EMERGENCY/PARK- AMM TASK 32-44-02-910-801-A/200 ING BRAKE - RELEASE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193CR Aft lower wing-to-fuselage fairing 192 192BR Center lower wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the Hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the Eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Hydraulic compartment or wing stub I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Control the rudder to the left and to the right until the pressure of the hydraulic system shows zero PSI on the EICAS. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-08 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Fully release the pressure from the fluid chamber of the emergency/parking brake system hydraulic accumulator ( AMM TASK 32-44-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Slowly open the charging valve of the nitrogen chamber of the hydraulic accumulator to let all pressure in it go out. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the hydraulic tubes (1) and (3). (2) Remove the check valve (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-08 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

HYDRAULIC TUBE 2. CHECK VALVE 1 1. HYDRAULIC TUBE 2. CHECK VALVE DET. D 2 3. HYDRAULIC TUBE 1 TORQUE: 11.8 - 13.0 N.m (104.5 - 115.5 lb.in). DET. C 2 EM145AMM320104C.DGN TORQUE: 15.0 - 16.6 N.m (133 - 147 lb.in). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-44-08 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. CHECK VALVE 1 1 3. HYDRAULIC TUBE 1. HYDRAULIC TUBE 2. CHECK VALVE DET. D 2 3. HYDRAULIC TUBE DET. C 1 TORQUE: 11.8 - 13.0 N.m (104.5 - 115.5 lb.in). 2 TORQUE: 15.0 - 16.6 N.m (133 - 147 lb.in). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-44-08-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. CHECK VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the check valve (accumulator or wing stub). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - BLEED OF AIR EMERGENCY/PARKING BRAKE ACCUMULATOR - AMM TASK 32-44-02-600-801-A/300 CHARGE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193CR Aft lower wing-to-fuselage fairing 192 192BR Center lower wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the Hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the Eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Hydraulic compartment or wing stub I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the check valve (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-44-08 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Connect the hydraulic tubes (1) and (3), and torque them as given in the related figure. Refer to (Figure 401) or (Figure 402). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (3) Pressurize the Emergency/Parking brake accumulator ( AMM TASK 32-44-02-600-801-A/300). (4) Pressurize hydraulic system 2 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (5) Do a check of the check valve for leakage. (6) Bleed the hydraulic line ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-44-08 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
